'''Little Freddie King''' (born '''Fread Eugene Martin''',<ref name="Offbeat">{{cite web|url=http://www.offbeat.com/2008/06/01/little-freddie-king-a-kings-life/ |title=Little Freddie King: A King’s Life |publisher=Offbeat.com |date=2008-06-01 |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref><ref name="King">{{cite web|url=http://www.littlefreddieking.com/?cp=1 |title=BLUES from New Orleans |publisher=Little Freddie King |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref> July 19, 1940, [[McComb, Mississippi|McComb]], [[Mississippi]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[Delta blues]] [[guitarist]].  His style was based on [[Freddie King]], although his own approach to [[country blues]] is original.<ref name="AMG">{{cite web|author=Richard Skelly |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/little-freddie-king-mn0000840389/biography |title=Little Freddie King | Biography |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref>

==Biography==
The cousin of [[Lightnin' Hopkins]], King learned guitar from his father, but in 1954 moved to [[New Orleans]] at the age of 14.<ref name="AMG"/><ref name="King"/> He played in many [[juke joint]]s with his friends [[Babe Stovall]], [[Slim Harpo]], and [[Champion Jack Dupree]], playing both [[acoustic guitar|acoustic]] and [[electric guitar|electric]] [[guitar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.last.fm/music/Little+Freddie+King |title=Little Freddie King – Free listening, concerts, stats, & pictures at |publisher=Last.fm |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref>

He recorded the first [[electric blues]] [[album]] in New Orleans with Harmonica Williams in 1969. In 1976, King undertook a [[Europe]]an [[concert tour|tour]] alongside [[Bo Diddley]] and [[John Lee Hooker]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.musicmaker.org/artists_profile/Little-Freddie-King |title=Little Freddie King Music Maker Relief Foundation, Inc |publisher=Musicmaker.org |date=1940-07-19 |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref> His next recording opportunity came some twenty seven years after his first in 1996, with the release of ''Swamp Boogie''.  King's ''Sing Sang Sung'' (2000) was recorded live at the Dream Palace in [[Faubourg Marigny]].<ref name="AMG"/> 

King is a charter member and has played the [[New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival]] for 42  years.<ref name="AMG"/> He is a member of the [[Louisiana Music Hall of Fame]]. Three times selected Blues Performer of the Year in New Orleans, King was presented with a Mississippi Trail Marker in [[McComb, Mississippi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mnblues.com/profile/little-freddie-king-ww.html |title=Little Freddie King Blues Profile |publisher=Mnblues.com |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref>

King's most recent album, ''Chasing tha Blues'' was released in 2012.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/gotta-walk-with-da-king-mw0001959853 |title=Gotta Walk With Da King - Little Freddie King | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2010-02-16 |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref><ref name="King"/> The album won Best Blues Album at the 12th Annual [[Independent Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.independentmusicawards.com/ima/2013/12th-annual-independent-music-awards-winners-announced |title=THE 12TH ANNUAL INDEPENDENT MUSIC AWARDS WINNERS ANNOUNCED |publisher=Independent Music Awards |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref>

==Discography==
*''Harmonica Williams and Little Freddie King'' (1969) - Ahura Mazda Records
*''Swamp Boogie'' (1996) - Orleans Records
*''Sing Sang Sung'' ([[live album]]) (2000) - Orleans Records
*''FQF Live'' (2003) - WWOZ (Library of Congress Recording)
*''You Don't Know What I Know'' (2005) - [[Fat Possum Records]]
*''Messin' Around tha House'' (2008) - Madewright Records
*''Gotta Walk With Da King'' (2010) - Madewright Records
*''Jazzfest Live'' (2011) - MunckMix, Inc.
*''Back in Vinyl, LP'' (2011) - APO Records
*''Chasing tha Blues'' (2012) - Madewright Records<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/little-freddie-king-mn0000840389/discography |title=Little Freddie King | Discography |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}}</ref><ref name="King"/>
